dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, Kazakhstan is gonna be super warm and wet this March, right? Kazhydromet said, uh, temperatures are already hitting 13 degrees.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, Kazakhstan is gonna be super warm and wet this March, right? Kazhydromet said, uh, temperatures are already hitting thirteen degrees.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 12: ... daytime temperature 11-13ÂC. [This is for Almaty only] ... meteorologists from Kazhydromet released their weather forecast for March 2025, predicting a warmer-than-usual and wetter-than-normal start to spring across Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, hold on, A. You're, um, getting ahead of yourself there. That 13 degrees, that's just Almaty, and that's the daytime for March 12th. Astana is a whole different story.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, hold on, A. You're, um, getting ahead of yourself there. That thirteen degrees, that's just Almaty, and that's the daytime for March twelfth. Astana is a whole different story.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: [Almaty] March 12: ... daytime temperature 11-13ÂC. [Astana] March 12: ... Night temperature -13 to -15ÂC, daytime temperature -2 to -4ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Astana? Wait, so it's not all warm across the country then? My bad, I thought it was, like, generally springy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Astana? Wait, so it's not all warm across the country then? My bad, I thought it was, like, generally springy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, not for Astana, unfortunately. On the 12th, uh, nighttime temperatures are still minus 13 to minus 15. Daytime only gets to minus 2 to minus 4. And fog, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, not for Astana, unfortunately. On the twelfth, uh, nighttime temperatures are still minus thirteen to minus fifteen. Daytime only gets to minus two to minus four. And fog, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: [Astana] March 12: Partly cloudy, no precipitation. Fog at night and in the morning. ... Night temperature -13 to -15ÂC, daytime temperature -2 to -4ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Minus? Yikes. So, like, just super cold and foggy, no actual snow expected yet?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Minus? Yikes. So, like, just super cold and foggy, no actual snow expected yet?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For the 12th and 13th in Astana, no precipitation. But by the 14th, that's when they're expecting, um, rain and snow, with icy conditions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For the twelfth and thirteenth in Astana, no precipitation. But by the fourteenth, that's when they're expecting, um, rain and snow, with icy conditions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: [Astana] March 12: ... no precipitation. ... March 13: ... no precipitation. ... March 14: ... precipitation expected (rain and snow), icy conditions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so Astana's still basically winter. But Almaty, that's where the warmer weather is at, right? Like, properly double-digit warm?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so Astana's still basically winter. But Almaty, that's where the warmer weather is at, right? Like, properly double-digit warm?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. Almaty, March 12th, daytime is 11 to 13 degrees. Nighttime is around zero. Pretty nice, comparatively.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. Almaty, March twelfth, daytime is eleven to thirteen degrees. Nighttime is around zero. Pretty nice, comparatively.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: [Almaty] March 12: ... Night temperature around 0ÂC, daytime temperature 11-13ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, for Almaty, any of that rain or snow coming up in those mid-March days?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, for Almaty, any of that rain or snow coming up in those mid-March days?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. For Almaty, March 12th, 13th, and 14th, no precipitation at all. Just partly cloudy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. For Almaty, March twelfth, thirteenth, and fourteenth, no precipitation at all. Just partly cloudy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: [Almaty] March 12: Partly cloudy, no precipitation. ... March 13: Partly cloudy, no precipitation. ... March 14: Partly cloudy, no precipitation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So, like, some places freezing, others quite warm, no rain for Almaty but snow for Astana... but then the other forecast said "warmer and wetter than usual" for March overall?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So, like, some places freezing, others quite warm, no rain for Almaty but snow for Astana... but then the other forecast said warmer and wetter than usual for March overall?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, that's the broader March 2025 outlook for all of Kazakhstan. Average temperatures are, um, expected to be two degrees above the seasonal norm for spring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, that's the broader March twenty twenty five outlook for all of Kazakhstan. Average temperatures are, um, expected to be two degrees above the seasonal norm for spring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, meteorologists from Kazhydromet released their weather forecast for March 2025... The average temperature is expected to be 2 degrees above the seasonal norm

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Mostly, yeah. Precipitation levels are, uh, exceeding normal across most of the country. But, like, not in the southwest and southern regions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mostly, yeah. Precipitation levels are, uh, exceeding normal across most of the country. But, like, not in the southwest and southern regions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: precipitation levels exceeding normal across most of the country, except in the southwest and southern regions

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So those specific areas, the southwest and south, they're, uh, just regular rain levels then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So those specific areas, the southwest and south, they're, uh, just regular rain levels then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. Average rainfall there. So, um, it's a bit of a mixed bag across the country, even with that general warmer trend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. Average rainfall there. So, um, it's a bit of a mixed bag across the country, even with that general warmer trend.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: except in the southwest and southern regions, where rainfall will remain within average levels.
